section.title: Present simple question form: I, you, we, they
section.sectiontitle: We use the Present simple to talk about things that are generally/always true. In the question, we use do + I/you/we/they + verb?
section.text1a: Do you live in Athens? Yes, I do.
section.text2a: Do your parents speak English? No, they don't.
section.sectiontitle2: We also use the Present simple for habits and routines.
section.text3a: Do they go out a lot? Yes, they do.
section.text4a: Do you drink a lot of coffee? No, I don't.
